com.sirqul.sdk.interfaces

Interface ISirqulProgressListener


  • public interface ISirqulProgressListener
    The listener interface for receiving ISirqulProgress events. The class that is interested in processing a ISirqulProgress event implements this interface, and the object created with that class is registered with a component using the component's addISirqulProgressListener method. When the ISirqulProgress event occurs, that object's appropriate method is invoked.
    Author:
    John Schleppy

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onProgressUpdate(double progress, long bytesSentOnUpdate, long totalBytesSent, long totalBytesToSend)
      On progress update.

    • Method Detail

      • onProgressUpdate

        void onProgressUpdate(double progress,
                    long bytesSentOnUpdate,
                    long totalBytesSent,
                    long totalBytesToSend)
        On progress update. Can be 0.0-100.0, where 0.0 means no data has transferred, and 100.0 meaning all data has transferred.
        Parameters:
        progress - the progress is an attempt to give a percentage, 0.0-100.0
        bytesSentOnUpdate - the bytes sent on this update
        totalBytesSent - the total bytes sent thus far
        totalBytesToSend - the content length for the data. If this is a negative value, it is unknown. If the data length exceeds Long.MAX_VALUE, this will also be a negative number.
